summary: This is an email chain from August 12, 2019, discussing overtime (OT) staffing issues at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in the context of Jeffrey Epstein's death. It focuses on the overtime worked by two officers, Noel and Thomas, who were on post at the time of Epstein's death, and requests a description of general OT issues at the facility.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 12, 2019, discussing staffing and overtime issues at the MCC following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
It specifically examines the overtime records of two officers, Noel and Thomas, who were on post at the time of Epstein's death.
It notes that Thomas, a warehouse officer, voluntarily signed up for all his overtime shifts and was off-duty in the 8 hours prior to them, indicating they were not mandated augmentations.
The correspondence requests a broader description of overtime staffing issues at the MCC generally.
